smell_analysis.justification: All provided diagram pages contain visible elements and are not empty.
All use cases (visual ovals) in the 'Treeningute funktsionaalne allsusteem' diagram are connected to at least one actor.
No distinct use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found in the use case diagram.
No packages were found containing multiple model elements with the same name.
No obvious data redundancy (denormalization) without foreign keys was detected in the class or database diagrams.
Use case naming appears consistent, generally following the 'Verb + Noun' pattern (e.g., 'Vaata aktiivseid treeninguid', 'Tuvasta kasutaja').
All states in the 'Treeningute seisundidiagramm' (e.g., Ootel, Unustatud, Aktiivne) appear to be reachable via transitions from the initial state.
All actions in the provided activity diagrams appear to be reachable through the defined decision flows.
Relationships in the class and conceptual diagrams generally include multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1) at the relevant ends.
The Use Case diagram 'Treeningute funktsionaalne allsusteem' (Page 2) contains 11 central elements (use cases), which exceeds the limit of fewer than 10.
No single class or table was found to have 6 or more visual connection lines on a single specific diagram page (The max observed was 5 connections for 'Isik' on Page 6 and 15).
Visual inspection suggests that the distances between related elements are generally within a reasonable range and do not violate the 'twice the average' rule.

In the activity diagram 'Treeningu aktiveerimise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4), the actions 'Andmed salvestatakse ning treening muudetakse aktiivseks' (Passive voice/Noun start) and 'Aktiveerimine ebaonnestub' (Noun start) do not start with an active verb.
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less (Note: 'Alg' is a state/node name, and 'Riik'/'Isik' are 4 characters).
Class names (e.g., Isik, Treening, Tootaja) are capitalized and singular.
Attribute and column names (e.g., e_meil, reg_aeg) start with lowercase letters.
Database table names (e.g., Treening, Isik, Riik) are singular.
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like tbl_, str_) were found. Abbreviations like 'kp' in 'sünni_kp' are considered part of the business term (kuupäev) rather than a type prefix.
